member.summary: A request representing a Capture - the final transfer of funds that happens after an auth.

member.summary: Queues the specified key into the request.

member.summary: Adds a Shipping Record to the current request

member.name: T:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields
member.summary: These are field names and explanations only

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.ApiLogin
member.summary: The merchant's unique API Login ID

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.TransactionKey
member.summary: The merchant's unique Transaction Key

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.AllowPartialAuth
member.summary: True, False

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.DelimitData
member.summary: Whether to return the data in delimited fashion

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.DelimitCharacter
member.summary: If the return from AuthorizeNet is delimited - this is the character to use. Default is pipe

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.RelayResponse
member.summary: The relay response - leave this set as TRUE

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.ApiVersion
member.summary: Required - The merchant's transaction version

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.TransactionType
member.summary: The type of transaction: AUTH_CAPTURE (default), AUTH_ONLY, CAPTURE_ONLY, CREDIT, PRIOR_AUTH_CAPTURE, VOID

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.Method
member.summary: CC or ECHECK

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.RecurringBilling
member.summary: The recurring billing status

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.Amount
member.summary: The amount of the transaction

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.CreditCardNumber
member.summary: The credit card number - between 13 and 16 digits without spaces. When x_type=CREDIT, only the last four digits are required

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.CreditCardExpiration
member.summary: The expiration date - MMYY, MM/YY, MM-YY, MMYYYY, MM/YYYY, MM-YYYY

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.CreditCardCode
member.summary: The three- or four-digit number on the back of a credit card (on the front for American Express).

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.TransactionID
member.summary: The payment gateway assigned transaction ID of an original transaction - Required only for CREDIT, PRIOR_ AUTH_ CAPTURE, and VOID transactions

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.SplitTender
member.summary: The payment gateway-assitned ID assigned when the original transaction includes two or more partial payments. This is the identifier that is used to group transactions that are part of a split tender order.

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.AuthorizationCode
member.summary: The authorization code of an original transaction not authorized on the payment gateway

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.IsTestRequest
member.summary: The request to process test transactions

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.DuplicateWindowTime
member.summary: The window of time after the submission of a transaction that a duplicate transaction can not be submitted

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.InvoiceNumber
member.summary: The merchant assigned invoice number for the transaction

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.Description
member.summary: The transaction description

member.name: F:AuthorizeNet.ApiFields.CustomerID
member.summary: The ID of the Customer as relates to your application

member.summary: Decrypts provided string parameter

member.summary: Encrypts the key/value pair supplied using HMAC-MD5

member.summary: Generates a 4-place sequence number randomly

member.summary: Generates a timestamp in seconds from 1970

member.summary: Authorizes and Captures a transaction using the supplied profile information.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.CustomerGateway.AuthorizeAndCapture(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Authorizes and Captures a transaction using the supplied profile information with Tax and Shipping specified. If you want to add more detail here, use the 3rd option - which is to add an Order object

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.CustomerGateway.AuthorizeAndCapture(AuthorizeNet.Order)
member.summary: Authorizes and Captures a transaction using the supplied profile information, abstracted through an Order object. Using the Order you can add line items, specify shipping and tax, etc.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.CustomerGateway.Authorize(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Authorizes a transaction using the supplied profile information.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.CustomerGateway.Authorize(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Authorizes a transaction using the supplied profile information with Tax and Shipping specified. If you want to add more detail here, use the 3rd option - which is to add an Order object

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.CustomerGateway.Authorize(AuthorizeNet.Order)
member.summary: Authorizes a transaction using the supplied profile information, abstracted through an Order object. Using the Order you can add line items, specify shipping and tax, etc.
member.returns: A string representing the approval code

member.summary: Captures the specified transaction.

member.summary: Deletes a payment profile for a customer from the AuthNET servers.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.CustomerGateway.UpdateCustomer(AuthorizeNet.Customer)
member.summary: Updates a customer's record.

member.summary: Updates a shipping address for a user.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.CustomerGateway.ValidateProfile(System.String,System.String,System.String,AuthorizeNet.ServiceMode)
member.summary: This function validates the information on a profile - making sure what you have stored at AuthNET is valid. You can do this in two ways: in TestMode it will just run a validation to be sure all required fields are present and valid. If you specify "live" - a $0.01 charge will be applied to the profile

member.name: T:AuthorizeNet.SubscriptionRequest
member.summary: This is the abstracted SubscriptionRequest class - it provides a simplified way of dealing with the underlying ARB API. This class uses a Fluent Interface to build out the request - creating only what you need.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.SubscriptionRequest.CreateMonthly(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Int16)
member.summary: Creates a monthly subscription request.
member.param: The number of billings. So if you wanted to create a monthly subscription that lasts for a year - this would be 12

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.SubscriptionRequest.CreateAnnual(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Int16)
member.summary: Creates an annual subscription.
member.param: The number of billings. So if you wanted to create a yearly subscription that lasts for a year - this would be 1

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.SubscriptionRequest.CreateWeekly(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates a weekly subscription that bills every 7 days.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.SubscriptionRequest.CreateWeekly(System.String,System.String,System.Decimal,System.Int16)
member.summary: Creates a weekly subscription that bills every 7 days.
member.param: The number of billings. If you want this subscription to last for a month, this should be set to 4

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.SubscriptionRequest.UsingCreditCard(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a credit card payment to the subscription. This is required.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.SubscriptionRequest.WithBillingAddress(AuthorizeNet.Address)
member.summary: Adds a full billing address - which is required for a credit card.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.SubscriptionRequest.WithShippingAddress(AuthorizeNet.Address)
member.summary: Adds a shipping address to the request.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.SubscriptionRequest.SetTrialPeriod(System.Int16,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Sets a trial period for the subscription. This is part of the overall subscription plan.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.SubscriptionRequest.ToAPI
member.summary: This is mostly for internal processing needs - it takes the SubscriptionRequest and turns it into something the Gateway can serialize.

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.SubscriptionRequest.ToUpdateableAPI
member.summary: The Update function won't accept a change to some values - specifically the billing interval. This creates a request that the API can understand for updates only

member.name: M:AuthorizeNet.SIMResponse.Validate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates that what was passed by Auth.net is valid

member.summary: Adds authentication information to the request.
